revised_title: The Distribution of Nerves in Striped Muscle Fibers
tldr: The author investigates the distribution of nerves in striped muscle fibers and concludes that every elementary fiber is abundantly supplied with nerves, forming a network on the sarcolemma surface. The nerves never penetrate the sarcolemma, and they run alongside smaller arteries and capillary vessels. The research also highlights the role of oval bodies or nuclei in the nervous phenomena and the development of new fibers.
